metadata.Description: Energy systems that generate and distribute energy at a local level, often using renewable sources and involving local communities in decision-making and ownership.

decentralized energy systems.Description: Decentralized energy systems implement building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
Decentralized energy systems provide funding for renewable energy projects.
Decentralized energy systems focus on community-based energy solutions to promote local energy production and consumption.
Decentralized energy systems are implemented in rural areas to provide access to clean and affordable energy.
Decentralized energy systems partner with local governments to implement sustainable energy solutions at the community level.
Decentralized energy systems contribute to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions through the use of renewable energy sources.
Decentralized energy systems monitor energy consumption to identify opportunities for energy efficiency improvements.
Decentralized energy systems target improved energy access for underserved communities.
